meanings.definition: A temporary withdrawal or cessation from work or activity.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, they took a recess to grab some snacks.
meanings.sent2: After a long day of playing, the children needed a recess to rest.
meanings.sent3: The recess from chores felt like a mini vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her mind needed a recess from the constant noise of the city.
meanings.sent5: The recess from social media helped her focus better.

meanings.definition: A small space created by building part of a wall further back from the rest.
meanings.sent1: The recess in the wall was the perfect spot to display a small sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The recess in the room was used as a cozy reading nook.
meanings.sent3: The recess in the hallway made a great hiding spot during the game.
meanings.sent4: The recess in the garden wall was filled with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The recess in the attic stored old family treasures.

meanings.definition: A break between classes in school.
meanings.sent1: During recess, the kids played tag and laughed together.
meanings.sent2: The students eagerly awaited the recess to go outside and play.
meanings.sent3: The recess bell signaled freedom for the students.
meanings.sent4: The recess period allowed the children to release their energy.
meanings.sent5: The recess break was a time for fun and games.
